trans-unit.source: Holds the list of items that constitute the content of an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref>.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> maintains a collection of items such as strings, objects, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xml-md.md)] nodes, elements, and other collections.
An <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> uses the data in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> to generate its content.

If you want to aggregate more than one collection, assign a <xref:System.Windows.Data.CompositeCollection> to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource%2A> property of your <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>.

Use either the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> property or the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource%2A> property to specify the collection that should be used to generate the content of your <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource%2A> property is set, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection will be made read-only and fixed-size.

This means that if you are using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource%2A> property, you cannot add, delete, or change items in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> directly.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> is a <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView> and therefore provides collection view functionalities, such as sorting, grouping, and filtering.

For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.SortDescriptions%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.Filter%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.GroupDescriptions%2A>.
For more information about collection views, see [Data Binding Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-overview.md).
Adds an item to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection"></xref>.
The item to add to the collection.
The zero-based index at which the object is added or -1 if the item cannot be added.
The collection is in ItemsSource mode.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports turning filtering data in real time on or off.
`true` if the collection view supports turning live filtering on or off; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports turning grouping data in real time on or off.
`true` if the collection view supports turning live grouping on or off; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports turning sorting data in real time on or off.
`true` if the collection view supports turning live sorting on or off; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this collection view supports filtering.
Use this property to check whether this collection supports filtering before assigning a filter callback to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.Filter%2A> property.
`true` if this view supports filtering; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this collection view supports grouping.

Use this property to test whether the current implementation supports grouping before using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.GroupDescriptions%2A> property to add <xref:System.ComponentModel.GroupDescription> objects.
`true` if the collection supports grouping; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this collection view supports sorting.

Use this property to check whether this collection supports sorting before using the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.SortDescriptions%2A> property to add <xref:System.ComponentModel.SortDescription> objects.
`true` if this view support sorting; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Clears the collection and releases the references on all items currently in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection"></xref> is in <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource"></xref> mode.

(When the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource"></xref> property is set, the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection will be made read-only and fixed-size.)
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified item is in this view.
The object to check.
`true` to indicate that the item belongs to this collection and passes the active filter; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at a particular array index.
The destination array to copy to.
The zero-based index in the destination array.
The array parameter is `null`.
The destination array is multidimensional.
The index parameter is less than 0.
Gets the number of records in the collection.
The number of items in the collection or 0 if the collection is uninitialized or if there is no collection in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource"></xref> mode.
Gets the current item in the view.
The current object in the view or `null` if the collection is uninitialized or if there is no collection in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource"></xref> mode.
By default, the first item of the collection starts as the current item.
Gets the ordinal position of the current item within the view.

The ordinal position of the current item within the view or -1 if the collection is uninitialized or if there is no collection in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource"></xref> mode.
Enters a defer cycle that you can use to merge changes to the view and delay automatic refresh.
This method is typically used to create a `using` scope and then place multiple view-changing calls within the scope.
This delays automatic refresh until the defer cycle is exited.
An <xref href="System.IDisposable"></xref> object that you can use to dispose of the calling object.
Gets or sets a callback used to determine if an item is suitable for inclusion in the view.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CanFilter%2A> property to test whether the current implementation supports filtering before assigning this property with a non-null value.
A method used to determine if an item is suitable for inclusion in the view.
Filtering is not supported.
Returns the item at the specified zero-based index in this view.

This method evaluates the index with any sorting, filtering, or grouping criteria that are set on the view using the <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView.SortDescriptions%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionView.Filter%2A> property.
The zero-based index at which the item is located.
The item at the specified zero-based index in this view.
index is out of range.
The collection is uninitialized or the binding on <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource"></xref> supplied a `null` value.
Gets a collection of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.GroupDescription"></xref> objects that defines how to group the items.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CanGroup%2A> property to test whether the current implementation supports grouping before adding <xref:System.ComponentModel.GroupDescription> objects.
This property can be set only by accessing the collection object and using its various methods, such as `Add`.
The property to access the collection object is read-only, while the collection itself is read-write.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection`1"></xref> of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.GroupDescription"></xref> objects.
The collection is indexed by the group levels.
Gets the top-level groups that are constructed according to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.GroupDescriptions"></xref>.
The top-level groups that are constructed according to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.GroupDescriptions"></xref>.
The default value is `null`.
Returns the index in this collection where the specified item is located.
The object to look for in the collection.
The index of the item in the collection, or -1 if the item does not exist in the collection.
Inserts an element into the collection at the specified index.
All items after the specified position are moved down by one.
The zero-based index at which to insert the item.
The item to insert.
The collection is in ItemsSource mode.
The index is out of range.
Gets a value that indicates whether the current item of the view is beyond the end of the collection.
`true` if the current item of the view is beyond the end of the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the current item of the view is beyond the beginning of the collection.
`true` if the current item of the view is beyond the beginning of the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the resulting (filtered) view is empty.
`true` if the resulting view is empty; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether filtering data in real time is enabled.
`true` if filtering data in real time is enabled; `false` if live filtering is not enabled; `null` if it cannot be determined whether the collection view implements live filtering.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether grouping data in real time is enabled.
`true` if grouping data in real time is enabled; `false` if live grouping is not enabled; `null` if it cannot be determined whether the collection view implements live grouping.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether sorting in real time is enabled.
`true` if sorting data in real time is enabled; `false` if live sorting is not enabled; `null` if it cannot be determined whether the collection view implements live sorting.
Gets or sets the item at the given zero-based index.
The zero-based index of the item.
The object retrieved or the object that is being set to the specified index.
The collection is uninitialized, or the item to set already has a different logical parent, or the collection is in <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource"></xref> mode.
The index is out of range.
Gets a collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in filtering data in real time.
A collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in filtering data in real time.
Gets a collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in grouping data in real time.
A collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in grouping data in real time.
Gets a collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in sorting data in real time.
A collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in sorting data in real time.
Sets the specified item in the collection as the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref>.
The item to set as the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref>.
`true` to indicate that the resulting <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref> is an item within the view; otherwise, `false`.
Sets the first item in the view as the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref>.
`true` to indicate that the resulting <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref> is an item within the view; otherwise, `false`.
Sets the last item in the view as the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref>.
`true` to indicate that the resulting <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref> is an item within the view; otherwise, `false`.
Sets the item after the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref> in the view as the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref>.
`true` to indicate that the resulting <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref> is an item within the view; otherwise, `false`.
Sets the item at the specified index to be the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref> in the view.
The zero-based index of the item to set as the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref>.
`true` to indicate that the resulting <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref> is an item within the view; otherwise, `false`.
Sets the item before the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref> in the view as the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref>.
`true` to indicate that the resulting <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CurrentItem"></xref> is an item within the view; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection needs to be refreshed.
`true` if the collection needs to be refreshed; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified item belongs to this view.
This method is typically used during collection-changed notifications to determine if the specified item belongs to this view.
The object to test.
`true` to indicate that the specified item belongs to this view or there is no filter set on this collection view; otherwise, `false`.
Removes the specified item reference from the collection or view.
When an item is removed from the collection, any remaining items with higher index values decrement their index by one as the size of the collection collapses.
The object to remove.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection"></xref> is read-only because it is in <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource"></xref> mode or if DeferRefresh is in effect.
Removes the item at the specified index of the collection or view.
When an item is removed from the collection, any remaining items with higher index values decrement their index by one as the size of the collection collapses.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection"></xref> is read-only because it is in <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource"></xref> mode or if DeferRefresh is in effect.
The index is out of range.
Gets a collection of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.SortDescription"></xref> objects that describe how the items in the collection are sorted in the view.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection.CanSort%2A> property to test whether the current implementation supports sorting before adding <xref:System.ComponentModel.SortDescription> objects to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.SortDescriptionCollection>.
This property can be set only by accessing the collection object and using its various methods, such as `Add`.
The property to access the collection object is read-only, while the collection itself is read-write.
A collection of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.SortDescription"></xref> objects that describe how the items in the collection are sorted in the view.
Gets the unsorted and unfiltered collection that underlies this collection view.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> object that is the underlying collection or the user-provided <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemsSource"></xref> collection.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
`true` if access to the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, `false`.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref>.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> has a fixed size; otherwise, `false`.
This member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> is read only; otherwise, `false`.
Adds a new item to the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
The new item that is added to the collection.
Gets a value that indicates whether a new item can be added to the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
`true` if a new item can be added to the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view can discard pending changes and restore the original values of an edited object.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
`true` if the collection view can discard pending changes and restore the original values of an edited object; otherwise, `false`.
Ends the edit transaction and, if possible, restores the original value to the item.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
Ends the add transaction and discards the pending new item.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
Gets a value that indicates whether an item can be removed from the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
`true` if an item can be removed from the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Ends the edit transaction and saves the pending changes.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
Ends the add transaction and saves the pending new item.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
Gets the item that is being added during the current add transaction.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
The item that is being added if <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView.IsAddingNew"></xref> is `true`; otherwise, `null`.
Gets the item in the collection that is being edited.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
The item in the collection that is being edited if <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView.IsEditingItem"></xref> is `true`; otherwise, `null`.
Begins an edit transaction of the specified item.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
The item to edit.
Gets a value that indicates whether an add transaction is in progress.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
`true` if an add transaction is in progress; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether an edit transaction is in progress.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
`true` if an edit transaction is in progress; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the position of the new item placeholder in the collection view.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
One of the enumeration values that specifies the position of the new item placeholder in the collection view.
Removes the specified item from the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
The item to remove.
Removes the item at the specified position from the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionView> interface.
The position of the item to remove.
Adds the specified object to the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionViewAddNewItem> interface.
The object to add to the collection.
The object that was added to the collection.
Gets a value that indicates whether a specified object can be added to the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionViewAddNewItem> interface.
`true` if a specified object can be added to the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a collection that contains information about the properties that are available on the items in a collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IItemProperties> interface.
A collection that contains information about the properties that are available on the items in a collection.
Receives events from the centralized event manager.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.IWeakEventListener> interface.
The type of the <xref href="System.Windows.WeakEventManager"></xref> calling this method.
Object that originated the event.
Event data.
`true` if the listener handled the event; otherwise, `false`.
